questionTitle: To our ________, Geoffrey's illness proved not to be as serious as we had feared.
You mustn't let him treat you so badly; you must stand ________ him and be strong.
The station clock is not as ________ as it should be; it is usually between one and two minutes fast.
Harvey: I think I'm well enough to get back to work. Gladys: Not really. You ________ stay at home for another day or so.
The two trains collided with ________ loud a crash it woke everyone in the station hotel.
We ________ the stolen car when the insurance money arrived.
I am looking forward ________ you again next year.
We live in a friendly community and everyone ________ each other very well.
Parking ________! By order.
It's customary to give at least a week's ________ before you leave the job.
More often ________ not, it rains here in summer.
Alan and Cyril used to hate each other, but now they are the ________ of friends.
If ________ I had married her when I had the chance!
After her husband's death, Ruby kept the business ________ for as long as possible.
He is very good ________ finding excuses.
________ any of these films before?
Would you mind ________ these plates a wipe before putting them in the cupboard?
The lung transplant operation was ________ complicated and the doctors had to take special care to ensure its success.
I ________ be most grateful if you could let me have the details as soon as possible.
Does anyone know ________ this coat might be?
